snippet: Dominating the oil-rich Hasaka province would mark a third major gain this week by insurgents, who also took a hydropower dam and an air base.
abstract: Syrian insurgency claims to have gained near-total control of Hasaka province, northeastern region that is home to some of few remaining domestic oil production facilities that supply fuel for Pres Bashar al-Assad’s military forces.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hwaida Saad and Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Dominating the oil-rich Hasaka province would mark a third major gain this week by insurgents, who also took a hydropower dam and an air base.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Claim Near Control of a Key Province
headline.print_headline: Control of Strategic Province Is Close at Hand, Syrian Rebels Say

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
